PtIncident.Summary: Amended early morning / late night Great Western Railway service from Monday 23 to Friday 27 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place across the Great Western Railway network, resulting in various lines being closed.

Monday

The 23:34 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway service will use alternative platforms at Tilehurst, Goring & Streatley and Cholsey will NOT call at Pangbourne. Customers for Pangbourne should travel to Tilehurst for a bus to Pangbourne taking 10 minutes. Customers from Pangbourne should travel by bus
from Pangbourne to Tilehurst to connect with a train.

Monday - Wednesday

The 23:52 London Paddington to Reading will NOT call at Burnham and Taplow

The 22:51 Newbury to London Paddington will NOT call at Taplow and Burnham.

Customers travelling to and from Burnham and Taplow should travel via Slough and a bus will operate from Slough to Burnham and Slough to Taplow.

Monday - Thursday

The 21:23 Portsmouth Harbour to Bristol Temple Meads service will terminate Westbury. Road transport will depart at 23:40 from Westbury to Trowbridge, Bradford-on-Avon, Bath Spa and Bristol Temple Meads.

The 22:30 London Paddington to Bristol Temple Meads will be diverted between Swindon and Bristol Temple Meads, NOT calling Chippenham and Bath Spa. Road transport will operate from Swindon to Chippenham and Bath Spa. This bus continues to Bristol Temple Meads.

Tuesday

The 00:45 and 03:54 Oxford to Reading services will use alternative platforms at Tilehurst, Goring & Streatley and Cholsey and will NOT call at Pangbourne. Customers for Pangbourne should travel to Tilehurst for a bus to Pangbourne taking 10 minutes.

The 20:18 St James Park to Barnstaple service will terminate Crediton. Road transport will depart at 20:47 from Crediton to Copplestone, Morchard Road, Eggesford, Umberleigh and Barnstaple. Road transport will also depart at 20:47 from Crediton to Yeoford.

The 21:15 St James Park to Barnstaple will terminate Crediton. Road transport will depart at 21:44 from Crediton to Copplestone, Morchard Road, Lapford, Eggesford, Kings Nympton, Umberleigh and Barnstaple. Road transport will also depart at 21:44 from Crediton to Yeoford.

The 21:41 Barnstaple to Exeter St Davids will start from Crediton 22:33. Road transport will depart at 22:07 from Barnstaple, Umberleigh, Eggesford, Morchard Road, Copplestone, Crediton and Newton St.Cyres to Exeter St Davids 23:45. Road transport will depart at 22:59 from Yeoford to Crediton and at 23:23 from Crediton to Yeoford.

The 22:39 Barnstaple to Exeter St Davids will NOT run. Road transport will depart at 23:07 from Barnstaple, Umberleigh, Eggesford, Morchard Road, Copplestone, Crediton and Newton St Cyres to Exeter St Davids. Road transport will also depart at 23:54 from Yeoford to Crediton to connect into this bus.

Tuesday - Wednesday

The 04:37 Gloucester to Worcester Shrub Hill will depart Gloucester earlier than normal at 04:17, Cheltenham Spa 04:28, normal timings at Ashchurch for Tewkesbury and Worcester Shrub Hill.

Tuesday - Friday

The 22:00 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids will arrive at Tiverton Parkway and Exeter St Davids approximately 20 minutes later than normal on Wednesday & Thursday morning and approximately 10 minutes later than normal on Friday morning.

The 23:45 London Paddington to Penzance “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will arrive at Exeter St Davids approximately 20 minutes later than normal on Wednesday & Thursday morning approximately 10 minutes later than normal on Friday morning. Train will run as normal after Exeter St Davids.

The 21:45 Penzance to London Paddington “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will depart Taunton approximately 12 minutes later than normal on Wednesday & Thursday morning and approximately 18 minutes later than normal on Friday morning. Normal timings at Reading and London Paddington.

The 00:34 London Paddington to Reading will NOT call at Burnham and Taplow.

The 00:18 Reading to London Paddington will NOT call Taplow and Burnham.

Customers travelling to and from Burnham and Taplow should travel via Slough and a bus will operate from Slough to Burnham and Slough to Taplow.

Thursday

The 21:00 Cardiff Central to Exeter St Davids service will depart Tiverton Parkway and arrive Exeter St Davids approximately 20 minutes later than normal.

The 21:04 London Paddington to Plymouth service will depart Tiverton Parkway and beyond approximately 10 minutes later than normal.

Thursday - Friday

The 04:37 Gloucester to Worcester Shrub Hill will depart Gloucester earlier than normal at 04:27, Cheltenham Spa 04:38, normal timings at Ashchurch for Tewkesbury and Worcester Shrub Hill.

Friday

The 23.34 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway will use alternative platforms at Tilehurst, Goring & Streatley and Cholsey and will NOT call at Pangbourne. Customers for Pangbourne should travel to Tilehurst for a bus to Pangbourne taking 10 minutes. Customers from Pangbourne should travel by bus from Pangbourne to Tilehurst to connect with this train.

PtIncident.Description:

High Speed services from London Paddington:

From 09:37 until 20:43 trains from London Paddington to Swansea will depart earlier at 35 minutes past the hour.

From 09:42 London Paddington to Hereford until 20:46 London Paddington to Worcester Shrub Hill inclusive, trains from London Paddington to Worcester / Great Malvern / Hereford will depart earlier at 37 minutes past the hour.

The 10:36, 12:37 and 14:37 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids trains, also 16:37 and 18:35 London Paddington to Plymouth will depart earlier at 33 minutes past the hour.

The 18:21 London Paddington to Oxford service will depart earlier at 18:07.

The 21:43 London Paddington to Swansea service will depart earlier at 21:40.

The 21:46 London Paddington to Worcester Shrub Hill service will depart later at 22:00.

Local services from London Paddington:

From 09:28 until 16:29, trains from London Paddington to Didcot Parkway will depart at 30 minutes past each hour and will not call Ealing Broadway and Hayes & Harlington.

The 17:29, 18:29, 19:29, 20:29 and 21:29 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway trains will not call at Ealing Broadway and Hayes & Harlington.

Local services to London Paddington:

From 08:48 until 21:50, trains from Didcot Parkway to London Paddington will not call Hayes & Harlington and Ealing Broadway.

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations between London Paddington and Slough until 08:50, closing all lines during these times.

High Speed services from London Paddington:

The 07:37 and 08:37 London Paddington to Great Malvern trains, also the 07:57 London Paddington to Penzance and 08:00 London Paddington to Plymouth trains will start from Reading.

The 08:33 London Paddington to Swansea train will start from Slough.

The 08:51 London Paddington to Penzance train will depart 08:56.

High Speed services to London Paddington:

The 07:45 Bristol Temple Meads to London Paddington train will call additionally at Slough.

The 07:58 Oxford to London Paddington train will terminate Slough.

The 08:24 Oxford to London Paddington train will terminate Reading.

Local services from London Paddington:

The 00:31 London Paddington to Reading train will depart earlier at 00:20.

The 06:44 London Paddington to Reading train and will start from Slough. A replacement bus will operate  from London Paddington, calling at Ealing Broadway, Southall, Hayes & Harlington to Slough to connect into the train below.

The 07:44 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway train will start from Slough. A replacement bus service will operate from London Paddington, calling at Ealing Broadway, Southall, Hayes & Harlington to Slough to connect into the train below.

The 08:29 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway train will start from Slough.

An additional train will depart London Paddington at 08:50 to Hayes & Harlington, Slough, Maidenhead, Twyford and Reading.

Local services to London Paddington:

The 06:25 Reading to London Paddington train will depart 06:58 and will terminate Slough. A replacement bus service will depart Reading at 06:25 to Twyford, Maidenhead and Slough.

A replacement bus will also be provided from Slough to Langley, West Drayton, Hayes & Harlington, Ealing Broadway and London Paddington.

The 07:10 Reading to London Paddington train will depart 07:28 and will terminate Slough. Earlier replacement bus service will operate from Slough to Hayes & Harlington, Southall, Ealing Broadway and London Paddington.

The 08:10 Reading to London Paddington train will depart 08:15, operating later than normal throughout.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended service through Southampton Central on Saturday 21 and Sunday 22 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Redbridge and Southampton Central, closing various lines.

CrossCountry:

Buses will replace trains between Southampton Airport Parkway and Bournemouth.

Great Western Railway:

Saturday:

Trains between Cardiff Central / Bristol Temple Meads / Westbury and Portsmouth Harbour will divert between Romsey and Fareham, not calling at Southampton Central. They will call additionally at Eastleigh for South Western Railway connections to / from Southampton Central. 

The following amendments will also apply:

Southbound:

The 06:50 Brighton to Portsmouth Harbour train will not run.

The 06:43 Frome to Southampton Central and 11:12 Westbury to Southampton Central trains will terminate Warminster.

The 10:52 Great Malvern to Brighton and 16:55 Great Malvern to Southampton Central trains will terminate Westbury.

Northbound:

The 08:30 Southampton Central to Great Malvern and 09:00 Brighton to Great Malvern trains will start from Warminster.

The 12:27 Southampton Central to Great Malvern and 17:00 Brighton to Bristol Temple Meads trains will start from Westbury.

The 21:23 Portsmouth Harbour to Westbury train will be diverted between Eastleigh and Romsey, not calling at Southampton Airport Parkway and Southampton Central. Normal timings Romsey and beyond.

The 21:32 Southampton Central to Bristol Temple Meads train will not run.

Sunday:

Except where shown below, trains between Cardiff Central and Portsmouth Harbour will divert between Romsey and Fareham, not calling at Southampton Central. They will call additionally at Chandlers Ford, also at Eastleigh for South Western Railway connections to / from Southampton Central.

Also:

To Portsmouth Harbour:

The 08:10 Cardiff Central to Portsmouth Harbour service will terminate Warminster. It will restart from Romsey at 10:59, diverting via Eastleigh.  A replacement bus will depart Warminster at 10:20 to Salisbury only (arrive 11:05).

The16:36 Cardiff Central to Portsmouth Harbour service will terminate Westbury. Customers to use alternative services.

From Portsmouth Harbour:

The 09:08 Portsmouth Harbour to Cardiff Central train will divert via Eastleigh and terminate at Romsey.
It will restart from Warminster at 10:48. A replacement bus service will depart Romsey at 10:10 to Salisbury only (arrive 10:45).

The 16:36 and 18:28 Portsmouth Harbour to Bristol Temple Meads trains will start from Westbury. Customers to use alternative services.

Certain trains will call additionally (on request) at Dilton Marsh.

South Western Railway:

Saturday

  • London Waterloo to Weymouth services will terminate at Southampton Central. Buses will run between Southampton Airport Parkway and Bournemouth (non stop).
  • Buses will run between Southampton Central and Brockenhurst and also between Southampton Central and Bournemouth (non stop).
  • A revised service will run between Brockenhurst, Bournemouth, Poole and Weymouth.
  • Salisbury to Romsey via Eastleigh and Southampton Central services will only run between Salisbury and Southampton Central via Romsey and Eastleigh.
  • Buses will run between Southampton Central and Romsey calling at Millbrook and Redbridge.

Sunday

  • London Waterloo to Bournemouth, Poole and Weymouth services will terminate at Southampton Central. Some services will call additionally at Swaythling and St Denys.
  • Buses will run between:
  • Southampton Airport Parkway, Bournemouth and Poole (fast)
  • Southampton Central, Bournemouth and Poole
  • Southampton Central and New Milton via Brockenhurst and Lymington
  • Southampton Central and Romsey
  • Passengers from London Waterloo for Bournemouth and Poole should change at Southampton Airport Parkway for fast buses to Bournemouth and Poole.
  • A revised service will run between Poole and Weymouth.
  • Buses will run between Southampton Central, Bournemouth and Poole.
  • Services between Brockenhurst and Lymington will not run. Buses will run between Southampton Central and New Milton via Brockenhurst and Lymington.
  • Salisbury to Romsey via Eastleigh and Southampton Central services will terminate at Romsey. Buses will run between Romsey and Southampton Central calling at Redbridge and Millbrook. Chandlers Ford will be served by diverted Cardiff to Portsmouth Great Western Railway Railway services.

PtIncident.Description:

07.40 Leeds - St Pancras will start from Sheffield

17.50 York - St Pancras will start from Sheffield

18.34 St Pancras - Leeds will terminate at Sheffield

Sunday:

The 12.50, 16.50, 17.50, 18.55, 19.50, 20.50 and 21.55 services from Kettering to Corby will be extended back to start from London St Pancras Internation, calling at Luton Airport Parkway, Luton, Bedford and Wellingborough.

The 12.20, 16.20, 17.20, 18.20, 19.20 and 20.20 services from Corby to Kettering will be extended to London St Pancras International, calling additionally at Wellingborough, Bedford, Luton and Luton Airport Parkway.

  • 13.13 Corby to St Pancras

  • 15.13 Corby to St Pancras

Saturday:

06:43 Sunderland to London Kings Cross.

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Westbury / Frome and Castle Cary on Saturday 14 and Sunday 15 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Frome and Castle Cary, closing all lines.

Buses will replace trains between Westbury / Frome and Castle Cary.

Great Western Railway 

"Local" Services:

Trains will run between Great Malvern / Gloucester / Bristol Temple Meads / Westbury and Frome and between Castle Cary and Yeovil Pen Mill / Weymouth. Most trains will depart Weymouth earlier than normal to maintain connections with the buses at Castle Cary.

Buses will replace trains between Frome and Castle Cary.

High Speed Services:

Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton (via Bristol Temple Meads where they will call additionally). Most will depart London Paddington and Reading 20 minutes earlier and some may be cancelled.

Most trains between London Paddington and Taunton / Exeter St Davids will run between London Paddington and Westbury only, with the exception of the below:

  • On Saturday, the 20:03 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids and the 16:20 Penzance to London Paddington will divert between Westbury and Taunton (via Bristol Temple Meads)
  • On Sunday, the 20:02 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids and the 17:50 Penzance to London Paddington will divert between Westbury and Taunton (via Bristol Temple Meads)

 

Additionally on Saturday, the 20:08 Paignton to Newton Abbot will not run.

Buses will replace trains between Westbury and Castle Cary.

South Western Railway:

Saturday

08:50 London Waterloo to Frome service terminates at Salisbury

The following services will not run:

The 07:36 Castle Cary to Salisbury.

The 11:30 Frome to Salisbury.

Sunday

The 16:12 Reading to Frome service terminates at Salisbury

The 17:45 London Waterloo to Yeovil Junction via Frome service terminates at Salisbury

The following services will not run:

The 11:30 Yeovil Junction / Frome to London Waterloo.

The 18:33 Frome to Salisbury.

Journey times between Slough and Burnham are 10 minutes and between Slough and Taplow are 20 minutes.

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Paddington and Acton Main Line / Ealing Broadway, closing 2 out of 4 lines from 21:00 on Saturday until 13:00 on Sunday.

Great Western Railway:

The following trains will depart 6 minutes earlier on Saturday night:

  • 21:20, 22:20 and 22:50 London Paddington to Oxford
  • 21:50 London Paddington to Worcester Shrub Hill

The following trains will depart earlier than normal on Sunday:

  • 09:37, 10:43, 11:43 and 12:43 London Paddington to Swansea will depart earlier at 35 minutes past the hour
  • 09:42 and 11:46 London Paddington to Hereford will depart earlier at 37 minutes past the hour
  • 10:46 and 12:46 London Paddington to Worcester Foregate Street will depart earlier at 37 minutes past the hour

The following trains will start from Slough on Sunday. Customers should use other trains from London Paddington to Slough:

  • 08:29, 09:28, 10:28, 11:29 and 12:29 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway

The following trains will terminate at Slough on Sunday. Customers should use other trains from Slough to London Paddington:

  • 08:10 Reading to London Paddington
  • 08:48, 09:35, 10:47 and 11:47 Didcot Parkway to London Paddington

Heathrow Express:

A reduced frequency service will run from 21:00 until the end of service on Saturday. Trains will run every 30 minutes in each direction between London Paddington and Heathrow Airport Terminal 5. Additional shuttle services will run between Heathrow Airport Terminals 2 & 3 and Terminal 5.

A normal service will run on Sunday.

TfL Rail:

London Paddington to Heathrow T5 service will be reduced to 2 trains per hour.

No trains will call at Acton Main, West Ealing or Hanwell. Customers should use LUL services to complete your journey.

    Basingstoke and Southampton Central

  • A revised service will run between Southampton Central, Bournemouth and Weymouth.

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the Grantham area, closing all lines.

Grand Central:

The following trains will not run on Saturday 14 November:

  • 08:44 Bradford Interchange to London Kings Cross
  • 11:27 London Kings Cross to Sunderland
  • 15:29 Sunderland to London Kings Cross
  • 16:48 London Kings Cross to Bradford Interchange
  • 17:29 Sunderland to London Kings Cross

  • 08:10 Bradford Interchange to London Kings Cross
  • 09:50 London Kings Cross to Sunderland
  • 11:50 London Kings Cross to Bradford Interchange
  • 15:59 Bradford Interchange to London Kings Cross
  • 19:22 London Kings Cross to Bradford Interchange

 

All other trains on the Sunderland / Bradford Interchange - London Kings Cross route will be diverted via Lincoln, increasing journey times by approximately 60 minutes. Some trains on Sunday may also be retimed to depart earlier / later than originally scheduled and the 18:12 Sunderland to London Kings Cross will instead start from York at 18:40.

East Midlands Railway:

All weekend, trains on the Nottingham - Skegness route will be diverted and will not call at Grantham. They will call additionally at Bottesford. A replacement bus service will run between Bottesford and Grantham.

On Saturday, trains on the Liverpool Lime Street - Norwich route will run as 2 separate services - between Liverpool Lime Street and Nottingham and between Nottingham and Norwich. Trains will also divert and not call at Grantham. Replacement buses will run between Nottingham and Grantham.

On Sunday, trains on the Liverpool Lime Street - Norwich route will divert between Nottingham and Peterborough, not calling at Grantham. Replacement buses will run between Nottingham and Grantham.

Hull Trains:

All Hull Trains services will divert via Lincoln and run to an amended timetable.

LNER:

An hourly service will operate to / from London Kings Cross, diverted via Lincoln.

Other services to / from Scotland / Leeds will be cancelled or will run between Scotland / Leeds and Doncaster only.

A half hourly service will run between Peterborough and London Kings Cross.

Replacement buses will run between Peterborough and Retford, calling at Grantham and Newark North Gate.

PtIncident.Summary: Major engineering in the London Kings Cross area on Saturday 17 and Sunday 18 October
PtIncident.Description:

Great Northern / Thameslink

All weekend, NO trains will run between London King's Cross / London St Pancras International / Moorgate and Potters Bar / Gordon Hill. Trains will run to a revised timetable between Potters Bar and Cambridge / Peterborough and between Gordon Hill and Stevenage

All weekend:

  • Gordon Hill and all stations to / from Alexandra Palace
  • Alexandra Palace and Turnpike Lane (London Underground).
  • Potters Bar and St Albans, connecting with Thameslink trains between St Albans and London St Pancras International on which tickets will be accepted
  • Potters Bar and Oakwood, calling at Hadley Wood, Cockfosters and Oakwood (London Underground stations)

 

Trains that usually run between Peterborough / Cambridge and Horsham / Brighton will be amended to run between London Bridge and Horsham / Brighton only.

Trains will run between Welwyn Garden City and Potter Bar, between Stevenage and Gordon Hill via Hertford North, between Potters Bar and Peterborough / Cambridge (after approximately 08:00), and also between Cambridge and King's Lynn.

Customers travelling between Kings Lynn and London should use Greater Anglia services between London Liverpool Street and Cambridge, and Great Northern services between Cambridge and Kings Lynn.

Please note: Gordon Hill and Cockfosters (London Underground) stations do not have step-free access. Customers who require step-free access for their journey, should speak to a member of station staff, press the emergency help point button, or contact our Assisted Travel team on 0800 058 2844 or text on 07970 511077. If you plan to continue your journey via London Underground services, please check Transport for London websites for information on their accessible stations.

LNER:

No LNER services will run between St Neots and London Kings Cross. A reduced service will run, with trains running hourly between St Neots and Leeds, and between St Neots and Newcastle / Scotland. Other LNER services will be amended to start / terminate at Peterborough / Retford.

Replacement buses will run between St Neots and Bedford, connecting with services to / from London St Pancras International.

It is not yet known how Grand Central, Hull Trains will be affected by this engineering work.

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

You can plan your journey on London Underground by using the Transport for London Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Project Information:

London Kings Cross station currently carries 33.8 million passengers per year, and is a major hub for both local and long distance train services. Major upgrade work will take place, upgrading and simplifying the track layout around the station for the first time in 40 years. Two new lines will also be added, increasing the number of services that can run to / from the station, as well as allowing for faster train services.

Affects.RoutesAffected: All routes to / from London Kings Cross and Moorgate

PtIncident.Summary: Amended service between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads on Sunday 1 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Worle and Highbridge & Burnham, and also in the Weston-super-Mare area, closing various lines.

As a result of this, the following alterations will apply:

CrossCountry

CrossCountry services will be diverted to not call at Weston-super-Mare. Passengers should use buses / trains between Bristol Temple Meads and Weston-super-Mare provided by Great Western Railway.

Great Western Railway

  • The 07:24 Bristol Temple Meads to Penzance service will terminate at Weston-super-Mare, then restart to run between Taunton and Plymouth. At Plymouth, it will connect with other trains to Penzance. At 07:56, a rail replacement bus will run between Weston-super-Mare and Highbridge & Burnham to connect with onwards rail connections. There will also be an earlier rail replacement bus between Weston-super-Mare and Taunton at 07:25 to connect with the restarted train.
  • The 08:05 Bristol Temple Meads to Penzance service will terminate at Weston-super-Mare and restart from Taunton to Penzance. A rail replacement bus service will run at 08:50 from Weston-super-Mare to Highbridge & Burnham, Bridgewater and Taunton for onwards rail connections.
  • The 09:40 Exter St Davids to Bristol Temple Meads service will start from Weston-super-Mare. A rail replacement bus service will run between Taunton and Bridgewater, and also from Highbridge & Burnham to Weston-super-Mare at 09:29 to connect with the train.

After 10:00, the following alternations will apply:

  • Trains will continue to run between Bristol Temple Meads and Weston-super-Mare.
  • Trains between London Paddington / Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton (and beyond) will not call at Weston Milton and Weston-super-Mare. Most services will additionally call at Worle. Passengers travelling to / from Weston Milton and Weston-super-Mare should change at Worle using replacement road transport.

Rail replacement bus journey times between Worle and Weston Milton / Weston-super-Mare may take up to 15 minutes via road.

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner. Please check back nearer to the time of travel.

Great Western Railway between Plymouth / Penzance / Exeter St Davids and Bristol Temple Meads / London Paddington

PtIncident.Summary: Amended Great Western Railway services to / from London Paddington late on Saturday 31 October and all day on Sunday 1 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Paddington and Acton Main Line, and also between Hayes & Harlington and Slough, closing some lines on Saturday evening and all day on Sunday.

Saturday:

The 21:50 London Paddington to Worcester Shrub Hill service will depart earlier, at 21:47.

The 21:57 and 23:28 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway services will depart 22:00 and 23:35, respectively.

The 22:20 and 22:50 London Paddington to Oxford services will depart earlier than usual, at 22:14 and 22:44, respectively.

The 21:30 Reading to London Paddington service will depart at 21:45.

Sunday:

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Reading and Blackwater from 23:55 until 05:15 each night from Monday 2 November, finishing on the morning of Friday 6 November.

The following alterations will apply from Monday to Thursday night -

  • 23:18 Gatwick Airport to Reading will terminate at Guildford. A replacement bus will run from Guildford to Reading, calling at North Camp, Blackwater and Wokingham.

 

The following alterations will apply from Tuesday to Friday morning -

  • 04:31 Reading to Gatwick Airport will start from Guildford. A direct replacement bus will run from Reading to Guildford, departing at 04:15. A second bus will run from Reading (at 04:20) to Guildford, calling at Wokingham, Blackwater and North Camp.
  • 04:49 Reading to Gatwick Airport will depart Reading at 05:15 and will operate later throughout its journey, arriving into Gatwick Airport at 06:25.
  • 05:16 Reading to Redhill will depart from Reading slightly later at 05:20.

 

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner. Please check back nearer to the time of travel.

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Between Reading and Redhill / Gatwick Airport

PtIncident.Summary: No service at Leeds from 22:40 on Saturday 31 October until 11:40 on Sunday 1 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in and around Leeds station from 22:40 on Saturday night until 11:40 on Sunday morning, closing all lines.

CrossCountry:

Late Saturday evening and Sunday until 1140. Trains will not call at Leeds.

CrossCountry will operate a replacement bus service between:-

Saturday night

  • Doncaster, Wakefield Westgate and Leeds

Sunday morning

  • Wakefield Westgate and Leeds
  • York and Leeds. 

East Midlands Railway:

Saturday

The 20:02 London St Pancras International to Leeds service will terminate at Sheffield.

Sunday

The following services will start at Sheffield:-

The 09:50 Leeds to London St Pancras International

The 10:50 Leeds to London St Pancras Ineternational

Customers are advised to use other alternative routes or services.

LNER:

From 22.40 Saturday until 11.40 Sunday there will be no services to or from Leeds station. Services will start or terminate at Doncaster or Wakefield Westgate. Throughout Saturday and Sunday Harrogate services will start and terminate at Leeds. 

Northern:

Buses will replace trains between:

Leeds and Wakefield Westgate.

Leeds and Knottingley.

Leeds and Castleford.

Leeds and Shipley.

Leeds and Ilkley.

Leeds and Garforth / York.

Leeds and Selby.

Leeds and Bradford Forster Square.

TransPennine Express:

From late Saturday evening to late Sunday morning, there will be no TransPennine Express train services through Leeds station. All services between Manchester and York during these times will be subject to an amended timetable. 

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace late night trains between Reading and Bedwyn on Monday 2, Wednesday 4 and Thursday 5 November
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Reading West and Bedwyn, closing all lines overnight on Monday 2, Wednesday 4 and Thursday 5 November.

The following alterations will be in place:

  • The 21:52 Newbury to Bedwyn will not run. A replacement bus will run from Newbury to Bedwyn
  • The 22:10 Reading to Newbury and the 22:44 Newbury to Bedwyn will not run. Two buses will depart Reading at 22:10 - one will call at all station to Newbury and the other will run direct to Newbury, then continue to Bedwyn, calling at Kintbury and Hungerford
  • The 22:19 Bedwyn to Newbury will not run and the 22:51 Newbury to London Paddington will start at Reading. A replacement bus will run from Bedwyn to Newbury then it will continue on to Reading, calling at Thatcham. A second bus will run from Newbury to Reading, calling at all stations
  • The 22:20 London Paddington to Bedwyn will not run. Replacement road transport will run between Reading and Bedwyn only, not calling at Reading West
  • The 23:17 Bedwyn to Reading will not run. A replacement bus will run from Bedwyn to Reading, calling at Hungerford, Kintbury, Newbury and Thatcham

No Southern trains will run to / from London Victoria.

Most services will be amended to run to / from London Bridge instead of London Victoria. Replacement buses will run between London Victoria and London Bridge.

Trains that usually run between Tonbridge and Redhill will be extended to run between Tonbridge and Reigate. Customers travelling between London and Reigate should change at Redhill.

Trains that usually run between London Victoria and Sutton / Epsom Downs will be amended to run between Clapham Junction and Epsom Downs. Trains that usually run between London Victoria and Epsom will be amended to run between Clapham Junction and Dorking.

Trains that usually run between London Victoria and West Croydon will be amended to run between Clapham Junction and West Croydon.

An amended service will run between London Bridge and Caterham.

Customers can use London Underground / London Bus services to complete their journey between London Victoria and Clapham Junction / London Bridge.

Engineering work is taking place between Lawrence Hill and Bristol Temple Meads closing the line.

Trains will be diverted between Lawrence Hill and Bristol Temple Meads via but not calling at Keynsham, where trains will change direction.

The following alterations will additionally apply to Great Western Railway:

Trains between Cardiff Central and Portsmouth Harbour will be diverted via Bristol Parkway, where the trains will change direction, and will call additionally at Lawrence Hill and will not call at Bristol Temple Meads.

Trains between Great Malvern and Southampton are diverted after Bristol Parkway and will run between Great Malvern and Cardiff Central. Customers travelling stations to / from Southampton Central will have to change trains at Bristol Parkway and at Bristol Temple Meads to complete your journey.

Trains between Cardiff Central and Taunton will run between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton. Customers should use alternative Great Western Railway trains between Cardiff Central and Bristol Temple Meads via and changing at Bristol Parkway.

Trains that usually run between Motherwell and Milngavie will be amended to run between Motherwell and Dalmuir.

A map of the service alterations can be viewed here.

PtIncident.Description:

As a result of these works, the 18:35 London Paddington to Plymouth service will terminate at Exeter St Davids.

The 19:03 London Paddington to Plymouth service will additionally call at Dawlish, Teignmouth and Ivybridge.

PtIncident.Summary: Bridge replacement work between Bristol Parkway and Newport from Sunday 25 October to Friday 6 November
PtIncident.Description:
Network Rail in conjunction with South Gloucester Council are replacing Gipsy Patch Lane railway bridge, Patchway, as part of the Cribbs Patchway Metrobus extension. Further information regarding this can be found here.

As a result, from Sunday 25 October to Friday 6 November, there will be no trains between Bristol Parkway and Severn Tunnel Junction.

CrossCountry

Trains between Manchester Piccadilly and Cardiff Central, via Bristol Parkway, will run between Manchester Piccadilly and Bristol Temple Meads only.

Customers should change at Bristol Parkway for Great Western Railway services between Bristol Parkway and Newport / Cardiff Central.

Customers travelling direct between Manchester Piccadilly and Cardiff Central may also use Transport for Wales trains. 

Great Western Railway

Between London Paddington and Cardiff Central / Swansea

Trains will run, but will be diverted via an alternative route between Swindon and Newport in both directions. As a result, trains will not call at Bristol Parkway. Buses will run between Bristol Parkway and Newport to connect with the diverted trains.

From Monday to Friday, at peak times only, there will be a very limited number of trains running direct between London Paddington and Bristol Parkway.

Between Portsmouth Harbour and Cardiff Central

Trains will run between Portsmouth Harbour and Bristol Parkway only. Replacement coaches will run between Bristol Parkway and Newport, to connect with train services between Newport and Cardiff Central.

Between Worcester Shrub Hill and Bristol Temple Meads

Sunday 25 October only, customers will have to change at Bristol Parkway to complete your journey.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey with CrossCountry using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Although journey planners are showing correct, your journey may be subject to alteration at short notice due to the Coronavirus outbreak. Please check before your journey.

These changes for Great Western Railway are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
CrossCountry between Manchester Piccadilly and Cardiff Central via Bristol Parkway

Great Western Railway between London Paddington and Cardiff Central / Swansea, between Cardiff Central and Brighton / Exeter St Davids / Portsmouth Harbour / Taunton / Penzance and between Worcester Shrub Hill and Bristol Parkway

PtIncident.Summary: Amended train services to / from London Paddington on Sunday 25 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Maidenhead and Reading, closing some lines and reducing train capacity to / from London Paddington.

Long distance services:

The 09:12 and 13:15 Plymouth to London Paddington services will depart earlier than usual, at 09:10 and 13:12 respectively.

The 10:36 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids service will depart at 10:35.

The 16:37 London Paddington to Plymouth service will depart at 16:35.

Train services between London Paddington / Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn will run hourly to an amended timetable, and will additionally call at Maidenhead.

Local services:

Trains between London Paddington and Didcot Parkway between 09:25 and 21:25 will be retimed by a few minutes between Slough and Didcot Parkway.

The following trains will not call at Burnham:

  • The 22:45 Didcot Parkway to London Paddington service.
  • The 23:27 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway service.
  • The 23:53 Didcot Parkway to London Paddington service.
  • The 23:53 London Paddington to Reading service.

Customers to / from Burnham should change at Slough for replacement buses between Slough and Burnham.

Check before you travel:

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place around Long Eaton before 08:30, and also between Luton and London St Pancras, closing some lines.

As a result:

  • The 06:50 Derby to London St Pancras International service will me amended to depart earlier than usual, at 06:12. This train is further amended to terminate at Luton by other engineering work. Customers travelling towards London should change at Luton for Thameslink services (which are unaffected by the engineering work).
  • The 07:29 Nottingham to London St Pancras International service will terminate at Luton. Customers travelling towards London should change at Luton for Thameslink services (which are unaffected by the engineering work).
  • The 07:51 Derby to London St Pancras service will start earlier than usual, at 07:17.

After 09:00, trains will be able to run between Luton and London St Pancras, however these will be subject to extended journey times.

Check before you travel:

Customers should use Southern services between New Cross Gate and Crystal Palace / West Croydon.

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Warrington Bank Quay and Manchester Piccadilly on Saturday 24 and Sunday 25 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the Newton-le-Willows area, closing various lines through the course of the weekend.

Northern:

Saturday

Leeds - Chester: Trains will run between Leeds and Hebden Bridge with bus connections to / from Manchester Victoria.

Liverpool Lime Street - Warrington Bank Quay: Trains will not run.

Liverpool Lime Street - Crewe: Trains will start from Manchester Piccadilly.

Crewe - Liverpool Lime Street: Trains will terminate at Manchester Piccadilly.

An additional hourly train service will run between Liverpool Lime Street and St Helens Central.

Buses will be provided between Huyton and Manchester Oxford Road (and vv), and between Huyton and Warrington Bank Quay.

Sunday

Manchester Airport - Barrow-in-Furness / Windermere via Wigan North Western: Trains will be diverted via Chorley.

Manchester Airport - Liverpool Lime Street: Trains will terminate at Manchester Piccadilly or Manchester Oxford Road.

Liverpool Lime Street - Manchester Airport: Trains will start from Manchester Oxford Road or Manchester Piccadilly.

Buses will be provided between Huyton and Manchester Oxford Road. Trains will be available between Liverpool Lime Street and Huyton.

TransPennine Express:

Services will run to an amended timetable between Liverpool Lime Street and Manchester Victoria.

Transport for Wales:

Services between Llandudno / Chester and Manchester Piccadilly / Manchester Airport will be amended to run between Llandudno / Chester and Warrington Bank Quay only.

Replacement buses will run between Warrington Bank Quay and Manchester Piccadilly, calling at Earlestown and Newton-le-Willows.

Buses will not call at Eccles, Manchester Oxford Road, Heald Green or Manchester Airport. Customers for these stations should use alternative train services.

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
Northern between Chester and Leeds

TransPennine Express services to / from Liverpool Lime Street

Transport for Wales between Chester and Manchester Piccadilly; and also between Llandudno and Manchester Airport

PtIncident.Summary: Reduced service to / from London Liverpool Street on Sunday 18 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the London Liverpool Street area, closing various lines throughout the day.

c2c

Trains will be diverted to start from / terminate at London Fenchurch Street and will call additionally at West Ham and Limehouse.

Passengers in possession of a valid rail ticket and travelling to / from Stratford may use the London Underground Jubilee Line between West Ham and Stratford at no extra charge. London Liverpool Street Station is a short walk away from London Fenchurch Street Station.

Furthermore, additional trains will run between Southend Central and London Fenchurch Street via Laindon. These trains will run non-stop Pitsea - Upminster in both directions.

Greater Anglia

Buses will replace trains between Billericay and Newbury Park Central Line tube station (via Shenfield). National Rail tickets will be accepted on TfL Central Line services between Newbury Park and Stratford / London Liverpool Street.

A train service will remain in operation between Southend Victoria and Billericay, and between Southminster and Wickford.

Due to a large volume of engineering work in Anglia and associated bus resourcing limitations, on this day the train/bus service on the Southend Victoria-London route will commence from approximately 10:00.

London Overground

Until 10:00 no London Overground trains will run between London Liverpool Street and Cheshunt / Chingford / Enfield Town.

Customers should use London Buses or London Underground on any reasonable route between London Liverpool Street and hackney Downs / Seven Sister.

Replacement buses will run between Seven Sisters and Cheshunt / Enfield Town

Replacement buses will also run between Hackney Downs and Chingford.

Stansted Express

Trains will be replaced by buses until 09:30 between Broxbourne and Stansted Airport.

TfL Rail

No trains will run between London Liverpool Street and Shenfield.

Customers should use London Buses or London Underground on any reasonable rote between London Liverpool Street and Stratford.

Replacement buses will run between Stratford and Romford calling at all stations

Buses will also run between Newbury Park (London Underground) and Shenfield calling at all stations between Chadwell Heath and Shenfield.

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Birkenhead North and New Brighton / Bidston / Leasowe on Sunday 18 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the Birkenhead North area, closing some lines.

Passengers travelling from New Brighton to Liverpool Central are to travel on the Rail Replacement bus service from New Brighton to Birkenhead North. At Birkenhead North passengers are to transfer to the rail service which will call all stations to Liverpool Central and vice versa.

Passengers travelling from West Kirby to Liverpool Central are to travel on the rail service from West Kirby to Bidston. At Bidston passengers are to join the Rail Replacement bus service to Birkenhead North. At Birkenhead North passengers are to re-join the rail service which will call all stations to Liverpool Central.

Please note that passengers with prams / luggage or who have mobility problems, should leave the train at Leasowe for the Rail Replacement bus to Birkenhead North.

Passengers travelling from Liverpool Central to West Kirby are to travel on the rail service as far as Birkenhead North. At Birkenhead North passenger are to join the Rail Replacement bus service which will call stations to Leasowe. At Leasowe passengers are to transfer to the rail service which will call all stations to West Kirby.

Engineering work is taking place between Slade Green / Sidcup and Dartford, closing some lines.

Southeastern:

Buses will replace trains between Slade Green and Dartford, and also Sidcup and Dartford.

Woolwich Line: Trains will run between London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Woolwich. Trains which normally run from Slade Green to London Cannon Street via Sidcup will run via Bexleyheath Instead. London Charing Cross to Dartford via Woolwich services will only run between London Charing Cross and Slade Green.

Bexleyheath Line: London Victoria to Dartford services will run between London Victoria and Sidcup instead. Additional services will run between London Charing Cross / London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Bexleyheath.

Sidcup Line: Victoria to Dartford services will run between Victoria and Sidcup instead. Cannon Street to Slade Green via Sidcup services will be diverted to run via Bexleyheath instead. Charing Cross to Gravesend services will not run.

Replacement buses will run on the following routes:

  • Sidcup to Dartford
  • Slade Green to Dartford

You can use the Docklands Light Railway between Lewisham and Greenwich at no extra cost. 

Thameslink:

No trains will run between Plumstead and Dartford. Customers can use their tickets on Southeastern bus / train services between Plumstead and Dartford.

Engineering work is taking place between Headcorn and Ashford International, closing all lines.

Buses will replace trains between Headcorn and Ashford International.

Trains between London Charing Cross and Ramsgate will be diverted between London Bridge and Ashford International to run via Maidstone East, stopping additionally at Chislehurst, Otford and Maidstone East.

These trains will also divide at Ashford International - with half the train continuing on to Dover Priory and half continuing on to Ramsgate via Canterbury West.  

Trains between London Charing Cross and Dover Priory will run between London Charing Cross and Headcorn only.

Passengers for Orpington should change at Chislehurst and passengers for Sevenoaks should change at Otford.

London Victoria to Dover services which normally run via Denmark Hill will only run between London Victoria and Sole Street.

Replacement buses will run between Meopham and Strood.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended midweek Southeastern service from Monday 19 to Friday 23 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place overnight at various locations, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday

The 23:54 Orpington to London Victoria will be diverted between Shortlands and Victoria. A replacement bus will run between Bromley South and London Victoria via Beckenham Junction and Herne Hill, calling at all stations to Herne Hill.

Tuesday to Friday

The 00:28 London Victoria to Orpington service will be diverted between London Victoria and Shortlands to run via Denmark Hill. A replacement bus will run from Denmark Hill to Orpington via Herne Hill & Beckenham Junction calling at all stations. Passengers for Brixton can use London Underground between Victoria and Brixton at no extra cost.

From 00:15 until the end of service buses replace trains between New Cross and Dartford via Greenwich & Woolwich & also between Lewisham and Dartford via Woolwich. Trains will be diverted to run via Sidcup instead.

Thursday and Friday

From 00:30 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Minster and Ramsgate and between Deal and Ramsgate.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Although journey planners are showing correct, your journey may be subject to alteration at short notice due to the Coronavirus outbreak. Please check before your journey.

No London Overground service will run between New Cross Gate and Crystal Palace / West Croydon.

A replacement bus service will operate between Dalston Kingsland and New Cross Gate via New Cross.

On Saturday, customers can use Southern services between New Cross Gate and West Croydon via Crystal Palace.

On Sunday, customers can use London Buses by any reasonable route, or Southern services between Sydenham and Norwood Junction / West Croydon.

Southern:

Replacement buses will run between New Cross Gate and West Croydon. Theses buses will also call at Crystal Palace. 

Thameslink:

Before 09:30, a reduced Thameslink service will run between London Bridge and East Croydon.

After 09:30, no Thameslink services will call at London Bridge or Norwood Junction, and a reduced service will run between London and Gatwick Airport.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning Northern services from Monday 12 to Friday 16 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking at various locations on the Northern network, closing some lines.

Monday - Thursday

The 22:31 Sheffield to Leeds service will not call at Woodlesford. A bus will be provided from Castleford to Leeds, calling at Woodlesford. 

The 23:28 Manchester Oxford Road to Liverpool Lime Street service will be replaced by a bus. Two buses will be provided: one bus will run from Manchester Oxford Road to Liverpool Lime Street calling at Warrington Central only; a second bus will run from Manchester Oxford Road to Liverpool Lime Street calling at all intermediate stations normally served by the train.

The 23:38 Liverpool Lime Street to Manchester Piccadilly service will be replaced by a bus. Two buses will be provided: one bus will run from Liverpool Lime Street to Manchester Piccadilly calling at Warrington Central only; a second bus will run from Liverpool Lime Street to Manchester Piccadilly calling at all intermediate stations normally served by the train.

The 22:34 Manchester Airport to Blackpool North service will not run. A bus will be provided from Manchester Piccadilly to Blackpool North.

The 23:19 Blackpool North to Manchester Airport service will be diverted via (but not call at) Wigan North Western. A bus will be provided from Preston to Manchester Piccadilly calling at intermediate stations via Chorley and Bolton.

The 23:31 Manchester Piccadilly to Blackpool North service will be diverted via (but not call at) Wigan North Western. A bus will be provided from Manchester Piccadilly to Blackpool North calling at stations via Bolton and Chorley, and stopping to drop passengers off from Leyland onwards.

Tuesday - Friday

The 04:44 Blackpool North to Manchester Airport service will be diverted via (but not call at) Wigan North Western. A bus will be provided from Preston to Manchester Piccadilly calling at stations via Chorley and Bolton. The bus will depart Preston at 04:16 to connect with services in Manchester.

The 04:46 Manchester Airport to Blackpool North service will be diverted via (but not call at) Wigan North Western. A bus will be provided from Manchester Piccadilly to Preston calling at stations via Bolton and Chorley.

The 05:05 Preston to Colne service will start from Blackburn. A bus will be provided from Preston to Blackburn, departing Preston at 04:45 to connect with the train at Blackburn.

The 06:22 Blackpool North to York service will start from Preston. Customers should use alternative service between Blackpool North and Preston.

Engineering work is taking place between Ashford International and Dover Priory, closing all lines.

Buses will replace trains between Ashford International and Dover Priory, with a minibus service running between Westenhanger and Sandling.

London Charing Cross to Dover Priory (via Paddock Wood) services will be amended to run between London Victoria and Ashford International.

High speed services between London St Pancras International and Ramsgate via Dover Priory will run between London St Pancras and Ashford International only. Services between London St Pancras and Margate via Canterbury West will run normally. Some additional train services will run between Dover Priory and Ramsgate via Deal.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Although journey planners are showing correctly, your journey may be subject to alteration at short notice due to the Coronavirus outbreak. Please check before your journey.

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Southeastern between London Charing Cross / London St Pancras International and Dover Priory / Ramsgate / Margate

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Lewisham and Orpington / Dartford (via Sidcup) on Sunday 11 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Lewisham and Orpington / Dartford (via Sidcup), closing all lines.

Buses will replace trains between:

  • Lewisham and Orpington.
  • Lewisham and Dartford via Sidcup.

Trains that usually run between London Charing Cross and Gravesend via Sidcup will be diverted to run via Bexleyheath, as will train services that usually run between London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Sidcup.

Trains between London Charing Cross and Ramsgate / Dover Priory (via Paddock Wood) will be amended to run to / from London Victoria. The services to / from Dover Priory will also be affected by engineering work between Ashford International and Dover Priory.

Trains between London Charing Cross and Hastings will be diverted between London Bridge and Orpington, and will be retimed.

Trains between London Charing Cross and Sevenoaks via Grove Park will not run.

Trains that usually run between London Victoria and Orpington via Bromley South will be amended to run to / from Sevenoaks.

Ticket acceptance:

Customers can use London Underground services at no additional cost between Victoria, Charing Cross, Embankment, Waterloo, Southwark, and London Bridge.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Although journey planners are showing correctly, your journey may be subject to alteration at short notice due to the Coronavirus outbreak. Please check before your journey.

You can plan your journey on London Underground by using the Transport for London Journey Planner

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Rainham and Sole Street / Strood, closing all lines.

Buses will replace trains between:

  • Rainham and Meopham.
  • Rainham and Strood.

Trains will run between London Victoria and Sole Street, and also between Rainham and Ramsgate / Dover Priory. Customers should change at Meopham for replacement buses to / from Rainham.

High Speed services via Gravesend will run between London St Pancras International and Strood only.

Services to / from Sheerness-on-Sea will be retimed to maintain connections with main line services.

Thameslink:

No Thameslink services to / from Rainham will run. Customers can use Southeastern bus / train services, Docklands Light Railway and London Buses to complete their journey.

PtIncident.Summary: No trains between Sole Street and Rochester on Saturday 10 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Sole Street and Rochester, closing all lines.

No trains will run between Sole Street and Rochester. Replacement buses will run between Meopham and Strood.

Trains that usually run between London Victoria and Dover Priory via Sole Street will be amended to run via Bexleyheath, and will run non-stop between London Victoria and Strood. These train services will be amended, with portions running between Faversham and Ramsgate and also between Faversham and Dover Priory.

Trains that usually run between London Victoria and Gravesend via Bexleyheath will not run. Customers should use alternative services to / from London Charing Cross.

Ticket acceptance:

Customers can use:

  • London Underground services at no extra cost between Victoria, Charing Cross, Embankment, Waterloo, Southwark, London Bridge and Cannon Street.
  • London Bus services at no extra cost on routes P12 / 78 / 484 between Denmark Hill and Lewisham.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning Northern trains from Monday 5 to Friday 9 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations on the Northern network, closing some lines overnight from Monday evening until Friday morning.

Monday to Thursday:

The 21:18 Blackpool North to York service will terminate at Leeds. A bus will be provided from Leeds to York.

The 22:56 Manchester Victoria to Leeds service will be diverted via an alternative route between Bradford Interchange and Leeds, and will not call at New Pudsey and Bramley. A bus will be provided from Bradford Interchange to Leeds to serve these stations.

The 22:57 Preston to Colne service will terminate at Rose Grove. A bus will be provided from Rose Grove to Colne.

The 23:19 Manchester Victoria to Leeds service will be diverted via an alternative route between Bradford Interchange and Leeds, arriving Leeds at 01:14.

The 23:28 Manchester Oxford Road to Liverpool Lime Street service will terminate at Hunts Cross. A bus will be provided from Hunts Cross to Liverpool Lime Street.

Tuesday to Friday:

The 05:19 York to Blackpool North service will start from Leeds. A bus will be provided from York to Leeds, departing York at 04:12 to connect with the train at Leeds.

The 05:20 Leeds to York service will be bus replaced throughout.

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

On Sunday, customers can use London Buses by any reasonable route, or Southern services between Sydenham and Norwood Junction / West Croydon.

Southern:

Buses will replace trains between New Cross Gate and Crystal Palace / West Croydon via Sydenham

Trains between London Bridge and Caterham / Crystal Palace will be diverted to run via Peckham Rye.

Thameslink:

On Saturday and Sunday, trains will be diverted between London Bridge and East Croydon, and will not call at stations via Sydenham / Norwood Junction.

All Thameslink services between Bedford / Cambridge / Peterborough and Gatwick Airport / Horsham / Haywards Heath / Brighton will run to an amended timetable, with extended journey times.

On Sunday, an amended and reduced service will run to / from Sutton, with trains running between Luton and Wimbledon only. Customers travelling to / from stations between Wimbledon and Sutton / Streatham should use London Buses.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning Southeastern services from Monday 5 to Friday 9 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations on the Southeastern network, closing some lines overnight from Monday evening until Friday morning.

Monday only:

From 22:50 until the end of service, buses will replace trains between Tonbridge and Wadhurst. Buses will run from Wadhurst to Hastings, except for the last service which is replaced by a bus from Tonbridge to Hastings. A mini bus shuttle will run from Battle to Crowhurst.

Monday to Thursday:

The 23:55 London St Pancras International to Faversham service will be replaced by a bus between Ebbsfleet International and Faversham.

Tuesday only:

From 23:45 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Tunbridge Wells and Hastings, with a minibus shuttle running between Battle and Hastings. Passengers travelling to stations after Battle will need to change buses at Battle.

Replacement buses that usually run on Tuesday nights between Faversham and Ramsgate, and also between Ramsgate and Margate will not run, and trains will run normally on these routes.

Tuesday to Friday:

From 00:35 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Meopham and Sittingbourne. Connecting trains will continue from Sittingbourne to Ramsgate.

From 00:15 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Lewisham and Dartford via Bexleyheath or Woolwich. Trains will be diverted to run via Sidcup instead.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night trains between Birmingham New Street and Wolverhampton from Monday 5 to Thursday 8 October
PtIncident.Description:
Late night engineering work is taking place in the Sandwell & Dudley area, closing all lines lines.

Avanti West Coast

Each night from 22:00 until the end of service, trains will be diverted between Birmingham New Street via, but not calling at,  Bescot Stadium and will not call at Sandwell & Dudley.

At present there in no replacement transport to / from Sandwell & Dudley.

London Northwestern Railway / West Midlands Railway

After 21:55 train services between Liverpool Lime Street / Crewe / Shrewsbury / Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street / Walsall / Rugeley Trent Valley will be diverted and will not call at intermediate stations between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street or will not run between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street.

Rail replacement buses will operate between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street (calling at all intermediate stations).

The 19:39 Birmingham New Street to Liverpool Lime Street service will terminate at Crewe (at 20:32).
The 21:34 Liverpool Lime Street to Birmingham New Street service will not run. Customers are advised to travel on the 22:35 Liverpool Lime Street to Crewe service. A rail replacement bus will operate between Crewe and Birmingham New Street.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended train services between Reading and Gatwick Airport on Sunday 4 October
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Wanborough and Guildford, and also between Earlswood and Gatwick Airport, closing various lines over the course of the day.

Before 15:30:

Trains between Reading and Redhill / Gatwick Airport will run at a reduced, hourly, frequency between Reading and Ash and also between Guildford and Redhill only.

Replacement buses will run between North Camp and Guildford / Gatwick Airport. Customers should interchange between buses and trains at North Camp instead of Ash.

Customers between Redhill and Gatwick Airport should use alternative train services.

After 15:30:

Trains will start to run between Reading and Redhill only. The first trains to run will be:

  • The 15:15 Gatwick Airport to Reading service (starting at Redhill).
  • The 15:18 Reading to Gatwick Airport service.

After this, trains will run between Reading and Redhill, with other rail connections between Redhill and Gatwick Airport.

The following trains will run through between Reading and Gatwick Airport:

  • The 21:18 Reading to Gatwick Airport service.
  • The 23:08 Gatwick Airport to Reading service.
  • The 23:15 Reading to Gatwick Airport service.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended service between London Paddington and Didcot Parkway from approximately 23:10 on Saturday 26 until 09:00 on Sunday 27 September
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Southall and Twyford, and also between Reading and Didcot Parkway, closing various lines.

Pangbourne

From approximately 23:10 on Saturday until 09:00 on Sunday morning, local trains which run between London Paddington and Didcot Parkway will not call at Pangbourne. Replacement buses will be provided to shuttle between Pangbourne and Tilehurst.

Burnham and Taplow

From approximately 23:45 on Saturday until 07:30 on Sunday morning, local trains which run between London Paddington and Didcot Parkway will not call at Burnham or Taplow. Replacement buses will be provided to run between Slough, Burnham and Taplow.

Please note that Taplow station does not have a train service on a Sunday, and no replacement buses will call at Taplow on Sunday either.

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Taunton and Exeter St Davids from 00:01 Monday 28 September to 05:00 Saturday 3 October
PtIncident.Description:
From 00:01 Monday to 04:00 Saturday morning, engineering work is taking place between Taunton and Exeter St Davids, closing the line.

Buses will replace trains between Taunton and Exeter St Davids extending journey times by up to 40 minutes.

The following alterations for will also apply for Great Western Railway:

  • The Night Riviera trains will be diverted and via but not calling at Yeovil Junction and will not call at Tiverton Parkway. Customers should use replacement bus service between Taunton and Exeter St Davids.
  • Some trains between London Paddington and Penzance are diverted via Yeovil Junction, not calling,  and will terminate / start from Plymouth
  • The 09:11 St James Park to Barnstable will depart earlier at 09:01.The 10:39 Paignton to Exmouth will depart at 10:39.
  • The 12:42 Gloucester to Frome will terminate at Westbury. Customers should use alternative trains between Westbury and Frome to complete their journey.
  • The 12:18 / 15:15 Taunton to Cardiff Central will depart earlier at 12:11 / 15:12 respectively.
  • The 13:11 Weymouth to Gloucester will terminate at Westbury. Customers should use alternative trains between Westbury and Gloucester to complete their journey.
  • The 15:35 / 17:33 Barnstable to St James Park will terminate at Exeter St Davids.  
  • The 17:12 /19:14 St James Park to Barnstable will start from Exeter St Davids at 17:19 / 19:22 respectively.
  • The 19:42 Barnstable to Exeter St Davids will now terminate at St James Park

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Blaenau Ffestiniog and Llandudno Junction until the end of service on Sunday 27 September
PtIncident.Description:
Storm Ciara, which bought 90mph winds, extreme rainfall and flooding across Wales on Sunday 9 February, caused extensive damage on the Conwy Valley Line, north of Llanrwst.

How is this affecting the train service?

A reduced rail replacement bus service will operate between Llandudno Junction and Blaenau Ffestiniog until the end of service on Sunday 27 September.

Engineers are installing a 2000m armoured bund to protect against further damage at sites previously affected by flooding. As a result of this, the line is expected to reopen on 28 September, but this is subject to change. 

Additional information:

Network Rail engineers inspecting the line have identified several sites where the ballast supporting the track has been washed away by floodwater. The storm has also damaged fencing and level crossings at several locations. Several weeks of repair work are underway.

Check before you travel:

You can check your journey up to and including Sunday 27 September using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner.

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:
